intro: Benthamia nigrescens subsp. decaryana, commonly known as the blackening benthamia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The subspecies is distinguished by its darkening flower petals, which turn a deep purple or black as they mature. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and limited distribution.
